TopicTitle: Interstellar Voyage - A Forum Thread of Gigantic Proportions

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone! This forum thread is what I'll use in posting my pictures and what happens on my next interstellar missions

Hope you like it!

Spoiler

new picture schedule inconsistent, expect some when you least expect it

For the first chapter, the objectives are:

  • Travel to two targeted stars
  • Observe and collect science

Off we go!

Spoiler

You can follow this thread to see updates of what I'll do on my next missions!
I realized that I should've added more radiators

Previous post editing

Edited January 16, 2022 by Kerbal Productions

DESTINATION 1
Lich / Pulsar

Arrival

"Orbit insertion"

Traveling to Dragur (these radiation beams are... good)

Arrival

Objective: Land and plant a flag (+ rescue 2 kerbals which I stuck on Dragur when recording a video)

Undocking of lander

Some good view of Dragur's surface

Landed, and by luck 15 meters beside stranded ship

Spoiler

This two-stage lander was stranded because I used it for recording once and I just left it there. And now I'm on Lich, I decided "why not rescue them the old way?" so I did and there we go

Summer Kerman surprised and angry because the flag went 2 km above the surface for no reason

Ascent back to warpship. Ore tanks are jettisoned because they're just a burden

Spoiler

Special image: 2 kerbals not exercising and just staring on the window

After docking, we're off to our last destination: Proxima Centauri

Yay(?)

Traveling...

DESTINATION 2
Proksimus Kirbani / Red dwarf

Arrival

Going to the other side

Here we are!

Lander undocking

Away and away!

Oof, no landing legs

Flag planting but without a flag. It's up in the sky for no reason. How conventional!

Some scenery!

Aurora and a shadow

Black and white "stuck in a planet" moment

They're stuck. 2 random crew and a Bill in here. Not much to worry 'bout but we'll get them back! (in a year or two) (and it's scorching hot here)

After no possible return ways for the crew, the warp ship points to Kerbol and activates the warp drive.

Departure from Proksimus Kirbani. Goodbye!

In between the stars. Arrival by 10 years 10 minutes

After some shenanigans, our blue planet is seen.

And also a rotation thing.

We're in (elliptical) orbit! Crew will be brought home soon.
But , crew who are stuck at proxima , will they die there or will be rescued at some time ? and what mod gives the warp drive
Your mission reports are remarkably lean on details. The pictures are pretty enough.

8 hours ago, mmamh2008 said:

will they die there or will be rescued at some time

let them live

9 hours ago, mmamh2008 said:

what mod gives the warp drive

late reply but I used KSPIE

The last pages of the first chapter...

Launch of the rocket with the payload where it will take the Kerbals home.

Spoiler

It has a capacity of 29 kerbals, since there are only 27 (or 24, the assigned tab said 27 and since there were 3 kerbals stuck...). there are still vacant
seats. It's better to have more!

MechJeb's assisting the ascent so I forgot to take a screenshot of the booster separation

Second-stage ignition!

Few moments later, fairing deployed and solar panels deployed (for "energy")

Spoiler

For KSPIE users, can I ask a question?

I don't have any energy flow, therefore there's no energy receiving. How do I fix that? It's most likely KSPIE.

Some rendezvous things

You can see the warpship!

Second stage separation, there's RCS on the payload so it can dock properly.

External camera pointing at... the centrifuge?

Or so I thought.

It's docked!

Spoiler

Good(?) view of Kerbin!

 

After a little while, all crew go to the ship. And by the way, the name of the "rescue" ship?

 

Undocking, camera is so close to the docking port

Docking port view

After de-orbiting stuff, I time-warp before the atmosphere

Inside the atmosphere. That's bright.

Notice the solar panels are gone? What's KSP without booms?!

Parachute deploy

 

Fully deployed

Tumble then fall. But it's fine. Crew is recovered and mission is done!

Spoiler

I plan to decommission not the whole warpship but the crew components only. The warp drive can actually be detached and anything can attach to it anytime with ease. If I want to bring a colony to Duna, I can just dock those stuff to the warp drive, and other stuff. In that way, the warp drive can be reused! And fun fact, there are two! docking ports around the warp drive: one before the EC thingy and after the warp drive. Rideshare, but heavy!

After a mission, the warp drive can just go back to Kerbin orbit and do the same. It is autonomous since it has a strong probe core.

Is it pretty genius?

Oh my god! 

Your game's visuals are stunning!

8 hours ago, AtomicTech said:

Your game's visuals are stunning!

Thanks! It's Galaxies Unbound revamping the stock system like it's a visual mod

And a matter of TUFX
See you on a new adventure...

what mod has the docking camera ?

 

Edit : It's docking camera (KURS)

Edited January 23, 2022 by mmamh2008

13 minutes ago, mmamh2008 said:

what mod has the docking camera ?

HullCamera VDS
A new chapter has arrived!

For the second chapter, the objectives are:

  • Test new scanning technologies
  • Pick out the best spot for a colony
  • Prepare all requirements for transportation

PHASE 1
Testing of new scanning technologies

Meet the golden rocket! It needs a better name, though

Liftoff! You see immediate gimbal to go to polar orbit.

Coast phase

Circularization burn is executed. 

Stage sep plus golden fairing sep as well.

After some coasting and mid-burn stuff, first two payloads are deployed.

Next payload deployed after an hour

Last one is deployed. Mission complete!

Warp drive undocks from the crew parts.

The "crew parts" will be... never mind, we'll just de-orbit that

Warp drive goes nearer to Kerbin for easier docking.

Spoiler

Maybe not, it left me on an eccentric orbit, and to make matters worse, it's inclined!

@Maria Sironayou might wanna look at this, I'm still planning my next video 

 

Testing of relay for colony/colonies!

Spoiler

Everything inside fairing sold separately for 500,000

With the efforts of the Galaxies Unbound Administration, they have provided us our next-next-next-next generation of relay antennae. They called it the Relay Antennae With Reassurance or RAWR

Spoiler

Named after our naming department's head had his first girlfriend.

Spoiler

Spoiler

Easter eggs....

 

 

Dethroning the stock antennae with more than 2 exabytes of... please tell the KSC what to describe

Although it left us with 2 million funds on debt, we can just mine it out on the runway

Meet the golden rocket 0.5! It contains the 4 probes with the scanning tech to see what's great for our colony to land on, as it will also be capable of making rockets, so instead of a painful Kerbin launch, we can launch from the outskirts of the system and go anywhere we want without the hassle of using an ISV or warp drive!

Gimbals galore!

This is a great view!

Gimbals galore again!

Circularization burn.

A lot of things happen with one stage:

Spoiler
  1. The golden fairing deploys
  2. The base of the fairing separates
  3. The first stage separates from the second stage
  4. The second stage engine is activated but throttle is off

After 10+ minutes (I forgot to screenshot), we arrive near the warp drive

Docked!

Warp drive charged and activated!

A distant star...

And after that, the game crashed  | Quicksave was a thing so I can just load it. | Updates this week, so that this journey will be perfect!

DESTINATION
Epsilon Eridani

Destination arrival.

Oh! We're going to the frozen moon, not the planet!

Wow.

Payload undocking! Mission almost done.

After a little fine-tuning of path, we arrive on  the first desired orbit.

Deployment!

This looks cool but this isn't where we are!

Here we are. Not that flat but it's rich on metal ore and ore. More than enough! And anomalies nearby 

Warp drive departs.

Arrival in 300 years a day!

Hello! I want you to suggest me what I should put in my colony space! You can send me your craft file(s), too!

Hope you interact with me as this'll be featured in my future video
